articles.content: It comes after the European Broadcasting Union, which produces Eurovision, said it is in talks with the BBC about the United Kingdom hosting in place of Ukraine, after it decided the war-torn country… [+2698 chars]

articles.author: Christopher J. Snowdon
articles.title: McCartney at 80 - Quillette
articles.description: Four score years of ordinary genius.
articles.content:
Im out here putting my feet up and relaxing, trying to pretend that I am just a normal person.~Paul McCartney, 1981

articles.author: Gaby Hinsliff
articles.title: The book that tore publishing apart: ‘Harm has been done, and now everyone’s afraid’ - The Guardian
articles.description: Kate Clanchy’s memoir about teaching won the Orwell prize. Then, a year later, it became the centre of a storm that would engulf the lives of the author, her critics and dozens of people in the book trade. So what happened?
articles.content: At the end of March, a book that had been condemned to die came back to life. There was no star-studded launch, and no great fanfare, although this book is now somewhat famous. The new publisher of t… [+31458 chars]
